fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.sort

Interface ISort

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<ISortCriteria>

    public interface ISort
extends Iterable<ISortCriteria>
    Defines sorting parameters for a data source provided by a connector.

    Instances of this interface can be used directly in for-each loops, to iterate over sort criteria.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    ICell.isSortable(), IListStructure.buildSort()

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(ICell cell)
        Gets the 1-based index of the cell if used as part of sort criteria.
        Parameters:
        cell - cell to evaluate, may or may not be part of the sorting criteria.
        Returns:
        the 1-based index of the cell, or 0 if not part of the sorting criteria.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISortCriteria.getIndex()

      • orderOf

        Order orderOf(ICell cell)
        Gets the order of the cell if used as part of sort criteria.
        Parameters:
        cell - cell to evaluate, may or may not be part of the sorting criteria.
        Returns:
        the order of the cell, or null if not part of the sorting criteria.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISortCriteria.getOrder()

      • exportSort

        void exportSort(OutputStream stream)
         throws IOException
        Exports the sort definition.
        Parameters:
        stream - non-null stream to write to. The stream will not be closed by this method.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the definition cannot be exported to the supplied stream.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISortBuilder.importSort(java.io.InputStream)

      • exportSortAs

        <T> T exportSortAs(Class<T> asType)
        Exports the sort definition as an instance of the specified type, if such a conversion is supported.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the class parameter and of the returned instance.
        Parameters:
        asType - the specified export type. There is no requirement for implementations to support any conversions other than to instances of String.
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified type, never null.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the requested conversion is not supported by this implementation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISortBuilder.importSort(Object)
